Google Imagery License

Google Imagery License

Background:

At the beginning of the year (2015), a coalition of state, regional, and local government agencies purchased a license to Google's high resolution (6 inch pixels) aerial photography [more info]. The license will allow Utah's cities, counties, special districts, state agencies, K12/Higher ed, and tribes to use this imagery in web and desktop mapping applications as a streaming web service or, where needed, on premise from downloaded local files. Also included is use by contractors and formal partners of the immediate licensees.

The imagery web services will be hosted in Google's cloud and delivered via WMS and WTMS standards and the downloadable files will be obtainable through AGRC who will have a master set of the raw imagery files.

  • View initial announcement that Utah Acquires High Resolution Aerial Photography License.
  • Sign up Information: View Using Utah's Google Imagery License (March 5th, 2015) to learn about the sign up process for Utah's license to use Google's 6" imagery services.
  • After reading the sign up information, you'll need to complete the Organizational Usage Agreement.
  • Find valuable information about using the Google Imagery Service.

    Any questions can be directed to Bert Granberg (801-538-3163) or Rick Kelson (801-538-3237).


    Diverging diamond interchange @ I-15 and 11000 North, Lehi
